name: The Daredevil and Frank Miller Trivia Quiz | Entertainment | 10 Questions

questions.text: Wilson Fisk, also known as the Kingpin, leaves his life of crime behind. Where does he temporarily reside?
questions.explanation:
Japan.

	Fisk married a woman named Vanessa and gave up his life of crime for her. They moved to Japan together, but returned to New York when she convinced him to turn over incriminating files to the federal government.

questions.text: When Daredevil loses his radar sense which makes up for his lack of sight, whom does he go to?
questions.explanation:
Stick.

	Stick was Daredevil's mentor who first helped him deal with his new powers. He later helped him bring his senses under control when they were elevated to nigh-unbearable levels.

questions.text: Which hardworking reporter deduces Daredevil's secret identity?
questions.explanation:
Ben Urich.

	Ben Urich is a chain-smoking reporter who serves as Daredevil's confidante and friend. He is an investigative reporter for the Daily Bugle, the New York newspaper run by J. Jonah Jameson.

questions.text: When Foggy attempts to learn more about Glenn Industries, what moniker does he use?
questions.explanation:
"Guts" Nelson.

	Franklin "Foggy" Nelson is Matt Murdock's partner and fellow attorney. He was also Murdock's roomate during law school at Columbia. Going by the name "Guts" Nelson, he came face to face with the Kingpin.

questions.text: Wilbur Day, known as Stilt-Man, was knocked out. Who stole his armor?
questions.explanation:
Turk.

	Turk was a lowlife criminal who ran into Daredevil again and again, despite his best efforts to the contrary. When not being used as a punching bag, he is an unwilling informant for Daredevil.

Bullseye.

	Bullseye proclaims that while Elektra is good at what she does, he is magic, and then kills her. This heats up the rivalry between Bullseye and Daredevil.

questions.text: Who is the nearly unkillable warrior that menaces Elektra?
questions.explanation:
Kirigi.

	Just as samurai feared the ninja, the ninja feared Kirigi. He is very strong and first appeared in the 174th issue of "Daredevil". He works for the Hand.

questions.text: Which crooked politician runs for Mayor of New York City?
questions.explanation:
William Randolph Cherryh.

	Cherryh had criminal ties to the Kingpin, ties which Ben Urich discovered. The Kingpin's influence kept the story from being published, until the masked hero Daredevil showed Kingpin that his wife Vanessa was alive.

questions.text: When Iron Fist and Power Man were eating pizza, who got the last piece?
questions.explanation:
"Foggy" Nelson.

	Nelson, Matt Murdock's partner and college roomate, hired Iron Fist and Power Man to protect Murdock during a high-profile case. Having been forbidden from eating pizza by his wife, Nelson couldn't resist a slice.

questions.text: In issue #183, to whom does Matt Murdock propose?
questions.explanation:
Heather Glenn.

	Heather Glenn knew about Murdock's life as Daredevil and was the CEO of Glenn Industries. She was struggling to keep the company under control, as the shareholders were anxious to force her out. She later killed herself.
